str2: In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Blameless, free from fault or defect. Irreproachable.
And, even, also, namely.
(lit: unmixed) simple, unsophisticated, sincere, blameless. Unmixed, i.e. innocent.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Blameless, without blemish, unblemished, faultless. Unblemished.
Middle, in the middle, between, in the midst of. From meta; middle (neuter) noun).
Crooked, perverse, unfair, curved, tortuous. From the base of skelos; warped, i.e. Winding; figuratively, perverse.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: To pervert, corrupt, oppose, distort. From dia and strepho; to distort, i.e. misinterpret, or corrupt.
From genos; a generation; by implication, an age.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Prolongation for the base of phos; to lighten, i.e. Show.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
A light, an illuminator, perhaps the sun; a star; brilliancy. From phos; an illuminator, i.e. a luminary, or brilliancy.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).
